page.title: 09CHURCH
page.content: RELIGION - CONTINUED.. The Church has 6 bells, three of which date to 1677-1763 two were added in 1911 and one in 1913. The registers go back to 1716. The Village Mermorial to those who fell in the World Wars is at the West end of the church, 15 names on one tablet (1914-18) one name on the second (1939-45). In the churchyard some of the grave stones have notable verses carved on them, warning us that death happeneth to all of us. Incorporated in the main steps to the porch is probably the oldest gravestone dated 1695. The church numbers some 20 attenders at Sunday services but for special services the congregation fills the church.
